Books which I have shown you during the course:

 1. R Cookbook by Paul Teetor

 2. R Graphics Cookbook by Winston Chang, [available online](https://r-graphics.org/)

 3. The R Book by Michael J. Crawley â€“ a great guide to statistics with R

 4. Visual Display of Quantitative Information by Edward Tufte: a beautiful
    book discussing principles of data presentation.

Use the way of R:

 1. [R Inferno](http://www.burns-stat.com/pages/Tutor/R_inferno.pdf)

 2. [arRgh](http://arrgh.tim-smith.us/)


Suggested general Links:

 1. Cheat sheets:
   * [R cheat sheet](https://rstudio.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/r-cheat-sheet-3.pdf)
   * [ggplot2](https://rstudio.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/ggplot2-cheatsheet-2.1.pdf)

 1. Formatting style

   * [Hadley Wickham's style guide](https://style.tidyverse.org/)
   * [R style guide from Google](https://google.github.io/styleguide/Rguide.html)

 2. R markdown:
  
   *  [R markdown definitive guide](https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown/)
 
 3. Stackexchange:

   * [StackOveflow](https://stackoverflow.com)
   * [CrossValidated](https://stats.stackexchange.com)
 
 4. [Statistical tools for high throughput data analysis](https://sthda.com)

 5. [R-bloggers](R-bloggers.com)

 6. Programming with tidyverse (heavy stuff!)

    * [Programming with tidyverse](https://www.r-bloggers.com/2019/07/bang-bang-how-to-program-with-dplyr/)

    * [Programming with dplyr](https://dplyr.tidyverse.org/articles/programming.html)

 7. Regular expressions

    * Use the man page ([link](https://stat.ethz.ch/R-manual/R-devel/library/base/html/regex.html))

    * Tutorial from [CRAN](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/stringr/vignettes/regular-expressions.html)

    * [Another tutorial](https://rstudio-pubs-static.s3.amazonaws.com/74603_76cd14d5983f47408fdf0b323550b846.html)

    * Regexp [lessons](https://regexone.com/) (not R!)

 7. Plotting

    * [Top 50 visualizations](http://r-statistics.co/Top50-Ggplot2-Visualizations-MasterList-R-Code.html)

 8. Developing packages

    * Specification: [Writing R extensions](https://cran.r-project.org/doc/manuals/r-release/R-exts.html) 

    * [devtools Cheat sheet](https://rstudio.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/devtools-cheatsheet.pdf)

    * [Happy git with R](https://happygitwithr.com/)
